Generation III.Ruby: Lairon tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This Pok é mon makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.
Generation III.Sapphire: Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the Pok é mon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.
Generation III.Emerald: When two Lairon meet in the wild, they fight for territory by bashing into each other with their steel bodies. The sound of their collision carries for miles.
Generation III.FireRed: It habitually shows off its strength with the size of sparks it creates by ramming its steel body into boulders.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It habitually shows off its strength with the size of sparks it creates by ramming its steel body into boulders.

Generation IV.Diamond: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.
Generation IV.Pearl: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.
Generation IV.Platinum: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It loves iron ore. Groups of them fight for territory by bashing one another with their steel bodies.

Generation V.Black: For food, it digs up iron ore. It smashes its steely body against others to fight over territory.

Generation V.White 2: Lairon fight over territory, and when their steel bodies collide, sparks fly.

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Lairon tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This Pokémon makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Lairon feeds on iron contained in rocks and water. It makes its nest on mountains where iron ore is buried. As a result, the Pokémon often clashes with humans mining the iron ore.

Generation VIII.Sword: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.
Generation VIII.Shield: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.
